intro: Schlechteranthus stylosus, commonly known as the slender false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas and has hairy stems and leaves. Its yellow flowers are arranged in a flat head, and it produces small, elongated fruits. It is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils, showing adaptability to various environmental conditions.
